value:
Even in the shade, this place is
sweltering. I'm contemplating a dive
into the ocean, if only to cool off.

The academy in Elusia would give us
time off in the summer, but our
vacations were nothing like this.

I wonder what my father would say
if he could see this beach. Probably
nothing—his face would say it all.

Elusian summers are short and cold.
Forget about the ocean—the air alone
will freeze you if you fail to cover up.

I've heard that snowfall at sea is a
uniquely pretty sight. I hope to show
it to the Divine Dragon one day.

I am Ivy. Before I go to find a colder
place to be than here...summer
tidings from $Nf.

I will admit, I've begun to experience
something resembling...fun.

I did not expect I'd be honing my
battle prowess while dressed for
the beach. A pleasant surprise.

I have any number of outfits that
would be better suited to—ugh, no.
Too hot.

Thank you for the gift. Could I trouble
you for an ice-cold drink as well?

I am Ivy, crown princess of Elusia.
Might you direct me to the chilliest
portion of this castle?

Despite the atrocious heat, and the
indignity of swimsuits, I've...begun to
become accustomed to being here.$k$pIn Elyos, where I come from, we sort
of merge with our Emblems when we
engage with them.$k$pSo when I began to think of this as
rather like...engaging with the essence
of summer, it became more palatable.$k$pBut do not take that as permission
to dress me up in more silly outfits!
I assure you this is my absolute limit.$k$pConsider directing your attention in
that regard to someone fun-loving
and inspiring—like the Divine Dragon.
I loathe summer.
Sweltering, is it not?
Cool off.
Summer engage!
I'm sunk...

I want nothing to do with swimwear or sandy beaches.
But for the Divine Dragon's sake, I will endure.
Hands to yourself, please. I have a sunburn.
The swimsuit I wore on the Somniel was rather more plain than this one.
First order of business upon returning to Elusia: research the means to export snow.
Yes, I do know how to swim—despite appearances to the contrary.
In case you haven't noticed, I don't enjoy the beach. I'd rather be in the snow. Or encased in a block of ice...

I've read many fond stories of the summer.
Perhaps I might tell my own someday.
Yes.
It's so hot...
I fear I may melt.
